intro: Wikstroemia palustris f. oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in wetlands and moist soils, often found in swamps and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
